explanation: Sjögrens syndrome is an autoimmune disorder that often presents with dry eyes and mouth, but it can also cause joint pain, swollen lymph nodes, and muscle pain. Blepharospasm, while less common, can be associated with the dry eye component.}, {diagnosis: Rheumatoid arthritis

explanation: Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune disorder that primarily affects the joints, causing pain, swelling, and stiffness. While less common, it can also cause eye inflammation (which can lead to irritated eyes) and swollen lymph nodes.}, {diagnosis: Lupus

explanation: Lupus is a systemic autoimmune disease that can affect various organs, including joints, skin, and eyes. It can cause joint pain, swollen lymph nodes, and eye irritation, and in some cases, blepharospasm can be a rare neurological manifestation.}, {diagnosis: Viral infection (e.g., Epstein-Barr virus, HIV)

explanation: Viral infections can cause a wide range of symptoms, including joint pain, swollen lymph nodes, and eye irritation (conjunctivitis). Blepharospasm is less common but can occur in some cases.}, {diagnosis: Sarcoidosis

explanation: Sarcoidosis is an inflammatory disease that can affect multiple organs, including the lungs, lymph nodes, eyes, and joints. It can cause joint pain, swollen lymph nodes, eye irritation (uveitis), and rarely, blepharospasm.}, {diagnosis: Tuberculosis

explanation: Tuberculosis is a bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs but can spread to other parts of the body, including lymph nodes, joints, and eyes. It can cause joint pain, swollen lymph nodes, eye irritation, and rarely, blepharospasm.}, {diagnosis: Lyme disease

explanation: Lyme disease is a tick-borne illness that can cause a range of symptoms, including joint pain, swollen lymph nodes, and eye irritation. Blepharospasm is less common but can occur in some cases.}, {diagnosis: Drug reaction

explanation: Certain medications can cause a hypersensitivity reaction that may manifest as joint pain, swollen lymph nodes, eye irritation, and rarely, blepharospasm.}, {diagnosis: Gonococcal arthritis

explanation: Gonococcal arthritis is a type of bacterial arthritis that can cause joint pain, swelling, and in some cases, eye irritation (conjunctivitis). Lymphadenitis and blepharospasm are less common but can occur.}, {diagnosis: Syphilis

explanation: Syphilis is a bacterial infection that can cause a wide range of symptoms in its later stages, including joint pain, swollen lymph nodes, and eye problems. Blepharospasm is a rare neurological manifestation that can occur in late-stage syphilis.}
